title: Frank Lampard talks 'best mum' Christine's 'sleepless' nights on 10th anniversary

Frank Lampard enthused Christine was the "best mum" as they celebrated their 10 year anniversary at Pride of Britain.

The sports star confessed his wife sacrifices her sleep to dote on their daughter Patricia so he can have a full night's rest.

Christine and Frank enjoyed a night off parenting to ring in the 10th anniversary since they met for the first time at the Pride of Britain Awards in 2009.

Speaking to the Mirror Online at the Pride of Britain Awards, he said: "Christine is the best, she's being humble, she's the best mum. She wakes up all the time. I sleep through!"

Christine was modest when she enthused her 13-month-old daughter was an "easy" newborn.

(Image: David Fisher/REX)

The Loose Women star said her little girl was "great" and "brilliant" as she fully immerses herself into her mothering role.

"She's great, she's brilliant," Christine said. "She's 13 months already. She's doing really well. She makes it [parenting] as easy as you can get."

(Image: WireImage)

Having first crossed paths at this very event a decade ago, Christine gushed Pride of Britain was a "very special evening" for the couple.

The mother-of-one noted it was "extra special" because she was acting as a judge for the glittering event this year.

She said: "We are [excited]. It's always a very special evening for us. I'm a judge this year and it makes it extra special."

The Daily Mirror Pride of Britain Awards, in partnership with TSB, will broadcast on ITV on 5th November at 8pm .
